intro: Neonauclea puberula, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silky neonauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, velvety foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptical in shape, and often have a distinctive pubescent surface. Neonauclea puberula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
